To access the boss, the player must have visited the Abyss at least once, either through the Mage of Zamorak or the fairy ring network.[1] As with all other slayer bosses, the Sire can only be fought when assigned abyssal demons or itself as an assignment. Although it resides in a multi-combat area, it is a solo-only boss.

The Abyssal Sire is an abyssal demon slayer boss that requires level 85 Slayer to kill. To access the boss, the player must have visited the Abyss at least once, either through the Mage of Zamorak or the fairy ring network.[1] As with all other slayer bosses, the Sire can only be fought when assigned abyssal demons or itself as an assignment. Although it resides in a multi-combat area, it is a solo-only boss.

According to The Overseer, the Abyssal Sires are the engineers of the Abyss from a time before the God Wars. As their resources began to deplete and they had no means to escape, they constructed the Nexus and remained there in deep stasis.

The Sire is located in the Abyssal Nexus, south of the Abyss used for Runecraft. It can be safely entered via the fairy ring code DIP (if the player has access to them), or it can be accessed via the Abyss although this drains the player's prayer points, and skulls them if not wearing an Abyssal bracelet. There are four chambers in the Nexus where Sire can be found, allowing multiple people to fight the Sire per world, similar to Cerberus.

Random events cannot occur in the Sire's chamber; any random events following the player will be automatically dismissed within appropriate range. Players in invalid tiles when a Sire is dormant will result in teleportation to the centre of the chamber.

It is known for dropping the Unsired, which is then used at the Font of Consumption behind The Overseer to get a chance of obtaining an abyssal whip, dagger, abyssal head, jar of miasma and untradeable parts of the abyssal bludgeon - the bludgeon axon, bludgeon claw, and bludgeon spine, as well as a very small chance at the Abyssal orphan.

As with all demons, the Sire is susceptible to the effects of demonbane weapons.

There is currently a bug causing deaths due to disconnection at Abyssal Sire to not provide a gravestone.[confirmation needed]

Fight overview[edit | edit source]

Main article: Abyssal Sire/Strategies

The fight consists of three phases:

  • The first phase focuses on killing the Sire's four respiratory systems on the sides of the room that heal the Sire. This is easily done by using Shadow spells on the ancient spellbook to disorientate the Sire in order to take down the respiratory systems, or otherwise deal 75 damage to Sire with ranged or mage to do so.
  • At the start of the second phase, the Sire gets off his throne to attack the player with melee. He may also summon Spawns and create highly poisonous miasma pools under the player. The Spawns are quite harmless at first, but they will mature into Scions after ten seconds who have more health and deal more damage.
  • When the Sire reaches 50% health, he will walk to the middle of the room to initiate the third phase. Instead of attacking himself, he rapidly summons miasma pools, which the player should avoid. When the Sire reaches less than 33% health, it will teleport the player next to him and trigger a highly damaging area-of-effect attack, which can be avoided by running away as soon as the player is teleported. He will also summon many spawns to attack the player. After the player finishes the Sire off, any spawns and scions will die alongside him.

The Sire respawns near-instantaneously upon death.

Drops[edit | edit source]

Drop rates estimated based on 40,840 kills from the Drop Rate Project, unless otherwise cited.

The average Abyssal Sire kill is worth 89,917 coins.

Excluding unsired drops, the average kill is worth 48,816 coins.

Combat Achievements[edit | edit source]

The following Combat Achievement tasks involve the Abyssal Sire.

Name Description Difficulty Category
Abyssal Adept Kill the Abyssal Sire 20 times. Hard Kill count
They Grow Up Too Fast Kill the Abyssal Sire without letting any Scion mature. Hard Mechanical
Don't Whip Me Kill the Abyssal Sire without being hit by any external tentacles. Hard Mechanical
Don't Stop Moving Kill the Abyssal Sire without taking damage from any miasma pools. Hard Perfection
Abyssal Veteran Kill the Abyssal Sire 50 times. Elite Kill count
Respiratory Runner Kill the Abyssal Sire after only stunning him once. Elite Mechanical
Demonic Rebound Use the Vengeance spell to reflect the damage from the Abyssal Sire's explosion back to him. Elite Mechanical
Perfect Sire Kill the Abyssal Sire without taking damage from the external tentacles, miasma pools, explosion or damage from the Abyssal Sire without praying the appropriate protection prayer. Elite Perfection

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
16 June 2021
(update | poll)

Abyssal Sire now drops abyssal ashes in place of regular ashes.

7 April 2021
(update)

Miasma pools will no longer deal damage after the Abyssal Sire has died.

9 January 2020
(update)

The Abyssal Sire will now be re-stunned correctly when autocasting shadow spells.

28 November 2019
(update | poll)
  • Players no longer deal "lost" hits and the Abyssal Sire transitions when expected during phases.
  • The Abyssal Sire can now be re-stunned with Shadow spells during the first phase while it is still stunned.
  • Players can now stun the Abyssal Sire to begin the fight, rather than attacking it once and then stunning it. However, the Sire must still complete its waking up animation. In order to do this the stunning of the Sire is not instant, and can result in the player being attacked by the tentacles if they approach the vents too quickly.
17 January 2019
(update)

The Abyssal Sire can now be slain as part of an Abyssal Plane Slayer task for Konar quo Maten.

22 February 2018
(update)

Players are no longer forced to re-attack the Sire immediately after waking it, as the attack they'd be prompted to use was frequently an unhelpful one.

24 August 2017
(update | poll)

The respiratory systems are now affected by the bonus damage and accuracy from an imbued slayer helmet.

21 - 22 July 2016

The NPC will now always appear above other characters or players standing on the same tile.

7 April 2016
(update | poll)

Shadow spells now have a 25, 50, 75 and 100% chance for shadow rush, burst, blitz, and barrage to stun the Abyssal Sire in the first phase, rather than a static 2/3 chance for any type of shadow spell.

31 March 2016
(update)

A warning message is now given when teleporting away from Sire's chambers with the Ancient Magick teleports, as the Sire is able to drop runes for such teleports, risking casting teleporting spells instead in subsequent kills. Annakarl Teleport was the most likely teleport spell used, as its spell icon was next to that of Blood Barrage.

8 October 2015
(update)

Added the Abyssal Sire to the Slayer skill guide and level up message.

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • A piece of artwork depicting the Abyssal Sire and its scions.

  • Abyssal Sire art from Jagex's turn-based card game Chronicle: RuneScape Legends

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • The Sire has multiple examine options that can be seen throughout the fight (including its Respiratory systems).
  • It is one of the few monsters that does not have a defensive animation; rather, it loops its idle animation instead.
  • Despite being a solo-only boss, the Sire's area-of-effect attack at 33% health and poison fumes can harm other players if they are in range.

  5. ^ Jagex. Mod Ash's Twitter account. 11 January 2016. (Archived from the original on 24 May 2020.) Mod Ash: "1/180."
